content.description: Nice flake that works to the top of the boulder, no crux. Fun problem.

This is a short, thin, trad crack close to FS 550. I named it Shotgun Express because it is short and I found a shotgun shell at the base. If you know the real name and FA info, please e-mail. I find it hard to believe I got the FA, since it is so close to the road. I found this boulder after getting lost trying to find A-hole rock. While some may consider it a high-ball boulder problem, it is better led. The bottom doesn't lend itself to a crash pad and the crux is at the top.
content.protection: Nuts, TCUs, to a #0.75 Camalot. I used 2 #1 Camalots for the anchor.
content.location: Go south on the Colorado trail for about 150 yards. Follow a old grown over jeep trail that veers left (south) for about 5-10 minutes. 13S0476906 4354473 on my GPS.

content.description: Climb the nice hand crack in the middle of the formation. Short fun climb.
content.location: About 100 ft west of the Colorado Trail on Forest Service Rd. 550, there is a faint, old, logging road toward the south, follow this old logging road staying left at the Y. Hike toward the top of the hill going south and then make a hard right toward the rocks. I call this area Tweaker Rocks due to some dude living in the area cooking meth back in 2002.

content.description: This is the crack that is just right of the "nose." In fact, it's the bottom part of the finish of the aid route. It has stout hands, off-sized, and finally thin fingers. It's burly for sure.

This is a real spire complete with a little summit.

Follow the bolt ladder. Last time I did this there where no hangers so come prepared.
content.protection:
Bolts.

Bring keyhole hangers or wire stoppers. Better yet replace the quarter inch bolts.
